front.title: DHCP Options for the Intel Preboot eXecution Environment (PXE)

abstract.t: We define DHCP options being used by Preboot eXecution Environment (PXE) and Extensible Firmware Interface (EFI) clients to uniquely identify booting client machines and their pre-OS runtime environment so the DHCP and/or PXE boot server can return the correct OS bootstrap image (or pre-boot application) name and server to the client.
